quests: Called as prophet before birth - consecrated from the womb
Prophesied judgment against Judah for 40 years
Witnessed and lamented the destruction of Jerusalem
Endured persecution, imprisonment, and attempted murder
titles: The Prophet of Doom and Hope
feats: Called before birth to be prophet to the nations
Purchased a field during the siege as sign of hope
companions: Ebed-Melech the Ethiopian (rescued him from cistern)
name: Jeremiah the Prophet | Jewish Heroes

primarySources.title: Book of Jeremiah
primarySources.description: Prophetic oracles, biographical narratives, and sermons

primarySources.title: Book of Lamentations
primarySources.description: Five poems lamenting Jerusalem's destruction - traditionally attributed to Jeremiah

newCovenantProphecy.hebrewText: הִנֵּה יָמִים בָּאִים נְאֻם־יְהוָה וְכָרַתִּי אֶת־בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת־בֵּית יְהוּדָה בְּרִית חֲדָשָׁה
newCovenantProphecy.translation: Behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah, not like the covenant that I made with their fathers... I will put my law within them, and I will write it on their hearts.
newCovenantProphecy.significance: The foundational prophecy of the New Covenant, distinct from the Mosaic Covenant
keyElements: New Covenant (berit chadashah) - not like the old
Law written on hearts, not stone tablets
Direct knowledge of God for all

hebrewsQuotation.note: Longest Old Testament quotation in the New Testament
hebrewsQuotation.significance: Jesus identified as mediator of this New Covenant

lastSupperConnection.text: This cup is the new covenant in my blood
lastSupperConnection.significance: Jesus explicitly invokes Jeremiah's New Covenant prophecy

righteousBranch.hebrewText: וַהֲקִמֹתִי לְדָוִד צֶמַח צַדִּיק וּמָלַךְ מֶלֶךְ וְהִשְׂכִּיל
righteousBranch.translation: I will raise up for David a righteous Branch, and he shall reign as king and deal wisely... And this is the name by which he will be called: The LORD is our righteousness (YHWH Tsidqenu).
righteousBranch.significance: Messianic king from David's line called by divine name

rachelWeeping.hebrewText: קוֹל בְּרָמָה נִשְׁמָע נְהִי בְּכִי תַמְרוּרִים רָחֵל מְבַכָּה עַל־בָּנֶיהָ
rachelWeeping.translation: A voice is heard in Ramah, lamentation and bitter weeping. Rachel is weeping for her children; she refuses to be comforted for her children, because they are no more.

matthewApplication.context: Applied to Herod's slaughter of infants in Bethlehem

philipPerspective.mosesAndProphets: Jeremiah confirms the prophetic testimony Philip cited
philipPerspective.newCovenantConnection: The New Covenant promised through Jeremiah, inaugurated by Christ
continuityAndFulfillment: Moses gave the Law at Sinai
Jeremiah promised a New Covenant surpassing it
Jesus is the mediator of that better covenant

parallels: Rejected by his own people and family (Jeremiah 12:6)
sufferingProphet.christConnection: Jesus wept over Jerusalem (Luke 19:41) like Jeremiah

rabbinicTradition.traditionOfDeath: According to tradition, stoned to death by Jews in Egypt
rabbinicTradition.authorOfLamentations: Traditionally composed the Book of Lamentations
rabbinicTradition.hiddenArk: Some traditions say Jeremiah hid the Ark of the Covenant before the destruction
rabbinicTradition.calledFromWomb: One of those called before birth (like John the Baptist)

description: Jeremiah (Yirmeyahu) is the prophet of the New Covenant, called before birth to prophesy judgment and ultimate hope. His ministry spanned the final years of Judah before the Babylonian destruction, and his New Covenant prophecy (Jeremiah 31:31-34) became foundational for understanding Jesus' work - the longest Old Testament passage quoted in the New Testament.
